description.narrative: Cairn Energy PLC (Cairn or the company) is a growing oil and gas company in the United Kingdom, with a strong focus on India and Bangladesh (96% of reserves.) Over the last few years, it has carried out a strong exploration and appraisal program, which has now started to yield significant discoveries. As a result, Cairn has turned its attention to the development of its assets. The company has asked IFC for a seven-year $40 million revolving corporate facility to finance their growing development expenditure needs in India and Bangladesh.

name.narrative: Cairn is an oil and gas company based in Edinburgh, Scotland whose operations are focused in South Asia. In addition to its headquarters in Edinburgh, Scotland, Cairn maintains offices in New Delhi and Chennai, India, and in Dhaka, Bangladesh, as well as project offices at its exploration and production sites. Cairn operations in South Asia include: Ravva, Andhra Pradesh Ravva field - offshore shallow water natural gas and oil production & onshore treatment facilities - KG-OS/6 & KG-DWN-98/2, Andhra Pradesh offshore deep water natural gas and oil exploration - CB/OS-2, Gujarat Lakshmi field - offshore shallow water gas production and oil exploration & onshore treatment facilities. Gauri field - offshore shallow water gas development & oil exploration - RJ-ON-90/1, Rajasthan onshore oil and gas exploration Cairn is the operator of all of the above. Cairn also has an interest in the Sangu Field in Bangladesh. Cairn announced on 15th September 2003 that it had signed an Asset Purchase Agreement to acquire Shells interests in the Sangu Field and exploration blocks 5 and 10, with an economic effective date of 1 July 2003. Subject to Bangladesh Government approval, Cairn will also assume the operatorship of the Sangu Field.
